sect3.title: Program Files
sect3.para: chage, chfn, chpasswd, chsh, dpasswd, expiry, faillog, gpasswd, groupadd, groupdel, groupmod, groups, grpck, grpconv, grpunconv, lastlog, login, logoutd, mkpasswd, newgrp, newusers, passwd, pwck, pwconv, pwunconv, sg (link to newgrp), useradd, userdel, usermod, vigr (link to vipw) and vipw

sect4.title: chage
sect4.para: chage changes the number of days between password changes and the date of the last password change.

sect4.title: chfn
sect4.para: chfn changes a user's full name and other information (office room number, office phone number, and home phone number).

sect4.title: chpasswd
sect4.para: chpasswd reads a file of user name and password pairs from standard input and uses this information to update a group of existing users.

sect4.title: chsh
sect4.para: chsh changes the user login shell.

sect4.title: dpasswd
sect4.para: dpasswd adds, deletes, and updates dial-up passwords for user login shells.

sect4.title: expiry
sect4.para: expiry checks and enforces a password expiration policy.

sect4.title: faillog
sect4.para: faillog formats the contents of the failure log,/var/log/faillog, and maintains failure counts and limits.

sect4.title: gpasswd
sect4.para: gpasswd is used to administer the /etc/group file.

sect4.title: groupadd
sect4.para: The groupadd command creates a new group account using the values specified on the command line and the default values from the system.

sect4.title: groupdel
sect4.para: The groupdel command modifies the system account files, deleting all entries that refer to group.

sect4.title: groupmod
sect4.para: The groupmod command modifies the system account files to reflect the changes that are specified on the command line.

sect4.title: groups
sect4.para: groups prints the groups which a user is in.

sect4.title: grpck
sect4.para: grpck verifies the integrity of the system authentication information.

sect4.title: grpconv
sect4.para: grpunconv converts to shadow group files from normal group files.

sect4.title: grpunconv
sect4.para: grpunconv converts from shadow group files to normal group files.

sect4.title: lastlog
sect4.para: lastlog formats and prints the contents of the last login log, /var/log/lastlog. The login-name, port, and last login time will be printed.

sect4.title: login
sect4.para: login is used to establish a new session with the system.

sect4.title: logoutd
sect4.para: logoutd enforces the login time and port restrictions specified in /etc/porttime.

sect4.title: mkpasswd
sect4.para: mkpasswd reads a file in the format given by the flags and converts it to the corresponding database file format.

sect4.title: newgrp
sect4.para: newgrp is used to change the current group ID during a login session.

sect4.title: newusers
sect4.para: newusers reads a file of user name and clear text password pairs and uses this information to update a group of existing users or to create new users.

sect4.title: passwd
sect4.para: passwd changes passwords for user and group accounts.

sect4.title: pwck
sect4.para: pwck verifies the integrity of the password files.

sect4.title: pwconv
sect4.para: pwconv converts the normal password file to a shadowed password file.

sect4.title: pwunconv
sect4.para: pwunconv converts a shadowed password file to a normal password file.

sect4.title: sg
sect4.para: sg sets the user's GID to that of the given group, or executes a given command as member of the given group.

sect4.title: useradd
sect4.para: useradd creates a new user or update default new user information.

sect4.title: userdel
sect4.para: userdel modifies the system account files, deleting all entries that refer to a specified login name.

sect4.title: usermod
sect4.para: usermod modifies the system account files to reflect the changes that are specified on the command line.

sect4.title: vipw and vigr
sect4.para: vipw and vigr will edit the files /etc/passwd and /etc/group, respectively. With the -s flag, they will edit the shadow versions of those files, /etc/shadow and /etc/gshadow, respectively.

sect4.title: libmisc
sect4.para: No description is currently available.

sect4.title: libshadow
sect4.para: libshadow provides common functionality for the shadow programs.
